detailedDescription.problem: Perform NCA analysis without any coding skills
detailedDescription.solution: Automates the preparation of PP, ADPP and TLGs based on the analysis settings from the user
detailedDescription.openSourceConsiderations: To increase the transparency, customization and standardization of NCA across pharmaceutical companies
detailedDescription.maintenanceModel: Corrective maintenance through GitHub issues or google sheet feedback survey (which is then transferred to GitHub). On GitHub we also allow discussions for new features or general questions.
detailedDescription.contributors: We have a CONTRIBUTING.md guidelines specifying how should you report issues, request features, review PRs and propose implementations: https://github.com/pharmaverse/aNCA/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
detailedDescription.userDetails: Pharmacometricians, clinical pharmacologists, preclinical scientists and regulatory professionals interested in performing NCA
detailedDescription.preRequisites: The package installation is CI/CD tested in Ubuntu-22.04 and Windows 11. It has some R package dependencies indicated in our DESCRIPTION file: https://github.com/pharmaverse/aNCA/blob/main/DESCRIPTION
detailedDescription.projectServiceOptions: All features needed to perform a complete NCA analysis: sample exclusions, exploratory plots, >140 PK parameters, half-life/AUC flags, partial parameter calculations, half-life adjustments, slides draft for dose escalation, PP/ADPP/final-ADNCA generation, TLG customization.
detailedDescription.sponsors: F. Hoffmann-La Roche AG, Pharmaverse, Appsilon
detailedDescription.goalsObjectives: Automate as much as possible NCA using CDISC standard assumptions
detailedDescription.communications: After the publication of a stable version in CRAN, a NEWS.md document linked to our website will be continually updated: https://github.com/pharmaverse/aNCA/blob/main/NEWS.md
